intro: Ranunculus aysenensis, commonly known as the Aysen buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Aysén region of southern Chile. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, usually yellow or white flowers. The plant features basal leaves that are deeply lobed and have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and often hairy as well. It typically grows in moist, cool environments such as meadows and streambanks. The flowers are short-lived, blooming in spring and early summer, and the plant is noted for its ornamental value in gardens.
